decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Y_001 Rev. B (Site location plan, existing and proposed block plans); Y_100 Rev. B (Existing lower and ground floor plans); Y_101 Rev. B (Existing first and loft floor plan); Y_102 Rev. B (Existing roof plan); Y_110 Rev. B (Existing elevations); Y_200 Rev. B (Proposed lower and ground floor plans); Y_201 Rev. B (Proposed first and loft floor plan); Y_202 Rev. B (Proposed roof plan); Y_210 Rev. B (Proposed elevations and section); Z_001 Rev. A (Site photos); Design and Access Statement
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the Mill Hill Park Conservation Area Management Plan and Appraisal (2007) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| All proposed front roof lights shall be of the non-projecting Conservation Area type and shall be installed flush with the plane of the roof and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring a high quality of design that preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the Mill Hill Park Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Any upper-flow window located in a wall forming a side elevation of the building must be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and D4 of the London Plan (2016).
description: Side/rear roof extension; installation rooflight to front roofslople; portico at front door, new sash windows and door replacement door; metal railings to front garden boundary; 1.8m security gate and fence alongside boundary
